title: Ticket #5347: Initialize OpenSSL threading in python bindings
description:
CERN noticed that if python bindings are used in a multithreaded python process and the native python HTTPS is invoked while a HTCondor GSI auth is ongoing, OpenSSL fails.

We suspect this is due to the fact that the GIL is released by the condor python bindings yet OpenSSL is not thread-safe by default.

We should implement the pithy callback functions to make sure OpenSSL is thread safe. See:

https://www.openssl.org/docs/manmaster/crypto/threads.html
